decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo by using cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Doomsday to stack the top of the library with specific cards, ultimately winning the game with Thassa's Oracle. Along the way, the deck utilizes various card draw, counterspells, and tutors to set up the combo efficiently and protect it from disruption. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion offers additional utility and resiliency to the deck in case the combo plan is disrupted.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard mechanics to quickly fill the battlefield with creatures like Prized Amalgam, Ichorid, and Narcomoeba. It aims to create explosive turns by dredging cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug to power out creatures for free. Cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect the combo pieces, while Chalice of the Void and Mental Misstep disrupt opponent strategies. With the help of Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, the deck can quickly fill the graveyard and overwhelm opponents with a relentless barrage of creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo, using cards like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Vampiric Tutor to find key pieces. It also includes protection in the form of Counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, allowing for additional recursion of combo pieces. The win condition is typically achieved by using Doomsday to stack the deck with Thassa's Oracle and a draw spell, ensuring a win on the following turn. The deck aims to control the game until it can find and execute the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Oath of Druids as a win condition, supported by control elements such as Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and disruptive creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Show and Tell and Flash are used to cheat out powerful threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes a number of tutors and card draw spells to ensure consistency in finding key pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around gaining control of the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo, utilizing various card draw spells and rituals to find and cast Doomsday, then stack the library to win with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes a mix of powerful Vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall, along with disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn, leveraging its speed and consistency to overwhelm opponents before they can react.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly in a one-on-one format. It aims to establish early board presence with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void. The deck includes mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus and Sol Ring, as well as land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. Overall, the key concept is to aggressively control the game and close it out with powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to lock down the opponent's resources with cards like Trinisphere, Sphere of Resistance, and Null Rod, while building a strong board presence with creatures like Scrawling Crawler and Patchwork Automaton. With access to powerful lands like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and maintain a relentless pressure on the opponent, ultimately leading to quick and decisive victories.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently to play powerful artifact creatures and planeswalkers, while disrupting opponents with cards like Trinisphere and Pithing Needle. It aims to control the game with powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, while using cards like Manifold Key and Scrawling Crawler to close out the game quickly with a strong aggro strategy. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines like Sensei's Divining Top and Mystic Forge to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to establish and maintain control over the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion to the deck, allowing for extra consistency and long-term advantage.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies with hate cards like Archon of Emeria, Void Mirror, Chancellor of the Annex, and White Plume Adventurer while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Witch Enchanter. It uses mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus, Moxen, and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. The deck aims to control the game tempo and limit the opponent's options while building a board presence for victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful counter spells and disruption, along with card advantage from cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also features a companion card, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, to provide additional value. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and out-control the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Vintage format.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game through countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage, while using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push, while also generating card advantage with spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian allows for additional card filtering and selection, ensuring that the player can consistently find the answers they need to maintain control over the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and controlling the game through counterspells and removal. It utilizes powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' game plans while generating card advantage through cards like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes a versatile companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, to provide additional value and recursion. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outlast its opponents and come out on top in the late game.

The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining card advantage and tempo through efficient spells and card draw. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Force of Will to control the game's pace. The inclusion of companions like Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value and flexibility. Cards like Swords to Plowshares, Spell Pierce, and Psychic Frog help maintain board presence and answer threats. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and take control of the game's tempo to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Mishra's Workshop to quickly ramp out artifacts and disrupt opponents with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere. It aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive artifact creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Stonecoil Serpent while also utilizing utility artifacts like Nettlecyst and Crucible of Worlds to gain advantages. By controlling the board with cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans and push through for quick victories with efficient artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts.

The key strategy of this Dimir Control deck revolves around utilizing disruptive cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce to control the game and prevent opponents from executing their game plan. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and counterspells like Daze to maintain board control. It leverages powerful card draw and selection spells like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time to ensure consistent access to answers and threats. The inclusion of companion card Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds additional value and resilience to the deck's game plan.
